antena: person who collects information or opinions
kyara: character (e.g. in a manga, anime, game, etc.)
kyanpufaia: campfire (usually large, and for gathering and singing, etc. around)
kuuru: season (series) of a television program (usu. 13 installments over a 3-month period) (fre: cours)
kukkii: cookie (browser-related file sent from a www server)
gurando: ground (e.g. land, electrical, base material of textiles, etc.)
gurei: gray (si unit of absorbed dose of radiation)
kureooru: creole (person of mixed ancestry, esp.in the caribbean)
koramu: stand-alone feature article framed by a box
konsooru: single console for multiple diving gauges
konte: var. kind of lead pencil (fre: conte)
shinonimu: synonym (partic. in computing and technical contexts)
suupaafamikon: super nintendo (和製: super fam(ily) com(puter))
sukin: skin (e.g. alternative look and feel for interface of a program)
sensu: good taste (for music, style, tact, etc.) (from sense)
sofutotenisu: soft tennis (using soft rubber balls instead of hard yellow balls)
daateii: dirty (often as in underhand, immoral, illegal)
daietto: losing weight by any method (e.g. exercise)
taimuseeru: special offers available for a limited time of the day (和製: time sale)
famikon: video game system (from family computer - nintendo tradename)
figyua: figurine (small models of anime characters, etc.)
burazaa: brother (usu. in names of films, companies, etc.)
furiiransaa: free-lancer (in a profession where employment is the norm)
purezento: to give a present or gift
hoon: phon (unit of loudness level of sound)
botto: bot (autonomous computer program, esp. on a network)
poppu: billboard (as used to decorate arcade games)
bodiibiru: special exercise for developing big muscles
popura: poplar (esp. lombardy poplar, populus nigra var. italica)
boryuumu: any kind of adjustment knob, not necessarily for sound
maagaretto: japanese women's hairstyle comprised of a long braid tied up in a loop with a ribbon (ca. 1885)
maneejaa: in a sports team (esp. at school) someone who does the routine drudge work
maya: maya (ancient indian tribe in central america)
meronpan: melon bread (sweet baked good with a bread-dough interior and a cookie-dough crust with ridges resembling a muskmelon) (和製: melon pan)
mozaiku: pixelated obscuring in images and video, usu. for censorship
monitaa: program or utility that monitors a program or activity
yotto: yacht (usually only used for a sailing boat with one mast)
raisu: rice (esp. when served on a plate)
ruu: curry sauce made from this powder
